conclusion: Analyze the motion of both the pedestrian and the bus using the given velocity-time graphs.
The pedestrian runs at a constant speed of 8 m/s.
The bus starts from rest and accelerates uniformly, reaching a speed of 8 m/s in 8 seconds.
The acceleration of the bus is 1 m/s².
The pedestrian starts running when the bus is 36 meters ahead.
The distance covered by the pedestrian in time t is 8t.
The distance covered by the bus in time t is (1/2)t².
Set up the equation 8t = (1/2)t² + 36 for the pedestrian to catch up with the bus.
Rearrange to form the quadratic equation (1/2)t² - 8t + 36 = 0.
Multiply through by 2 to clear the fraction, resulting in t² - 16t + 72 = 0.
Solve the quadratic equation using the quadratic formula.
Since the discriminant is negative, there are no real solutions for t.
The pedestrian cannot catch up with the bus.
